Synthesis Method: Ball milling; mixed with 20 wt% TiCrNbHx‑MS
Key Findings: Cycling at 300 °C yields 81 % capacity retention over 100 cycles; dehydrogenation activation energy markedly reduced by TiCrNbHx‑MS catalyst.; Hydrogen storage properties of MgH2 enhanced by TiCrNb hydride catalyst
Comments: First dehydrogenation takes ~5 min, subsequent cycles ~3 min; no new phases after cycling.; Primary hydrogen storage material

Key Findings: Absorbs 2.83 wt% H2 at 150 °C, enabling uptake at 25 °C.
Comments: Transforms to FCC TiCrNbHx‑MS hydride after full rehydrogenation.

Key Findings: Mg‑20 wt% Ti0.16Cr0.24V0.6 composite dehydrogenated 5.67 wt% H₂ in 20 min at 270 °C, 0.01 MPa.
Comments: Nanocrystalline alloy produced by reactive ball milling.

Temperature Range: room temperature to 230°C; Dehydrogenation at 163 °C; cycling at 300 °C
Synthesis Method: Melt spinning; ball milling with MgH2; Melt spinning followed by full hydrogenation
Key Findings: Initial dehydrogenation at 163 °C; 5.8 wt% H2 released in 700 s at 230 °C; 4.3 wt% absorbed in 2 min at 150 °C; Dehydrogenation temperature reduced to 163 °C and activation energy to 73.29 kJ mol⁻¹
Comments: FCC phase transforms to BCC during cycling; Added 20 wt% to MgH₂ via ball milling; 81 % capacity retained over 100 cycles

Synthesis Method: Melt spinning of Ti45Cr40Nb15 alloy; Melt spinning; incorporated via ball milling (20 wt%)
Key Findings: Melt‑spun Ti45Cr40Nb15 hydride (TiCrNbHx‑MS) synthesized as catalyst for MgH₂.; Reduces dehydrogenation enthalpy to 75.5 kJ mol⁻¹ H₂ and activation energy ~50 % lower; composite retains 81 % capacity after 100 cycles.
Comments: Single BCC phase via rapid solidification.; Hydride phase (FCC) formed after rehydrogenation of TiCrNb‑MS.; No new phases detected after cycling; rapid initial capacity drop then stable performance.

Key Findings: Des‑Ea = 73.29 kJ·mol⁻¹, onset dehydrogenation 163 °C, 4.3 wt% absorbed in 2 min at 150 °C
Comments: Surface penetration is rate‑determining; tc 815 s at 230 °C decreasing to 362 s at 270 °C

Key Findings: 6 wt% H2 released in 12 min at 225 °C; 5 wt% absorbed in 20 s at RT
Catalyzed MgH₂ releasing 5.7 wt% H₂ in 30 min at 290 °C, >90 % reabsorption at 100 °C.
